SEARCH

AtlasVenture

  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    AudioManager
    Class responsible for loading music and sounds and providing methods for playback, stopping, and changing.
    DebugMode
    The `DebugMode` class allows developers to access debugging features in a game by entering a password and provides functionality to create debug game data.
    GameData
    The `GameData` class in Java represents game data for a player including username, score, hints used, level completed, and levels left.
    GameDataManager
    This class is responsible for managing the game data, including saving and loading player game data, updating player data, retrieving usernames from file contents, ensuring correct JSON file path, converting a string to SHA1, and getting top scores and information from the game data.
    GameFrame
    The `GameFrame` class in Java initializes screens for a game application and sets up the frame for the game.
    GameManager
    The `GameManager` class in Java represents a game manager that handles game state transitions, window initialization, game loop setup, and screen switching using CardLayout.
    GameModeScreen
    Represents a game mode selection screen where players can choose between different types of game modes.
    GameScreen
    Represents a generic game screen within the application.
    HighScoreScreen
    The HighScoreScreen class represents a screen displaying the high scores from previous game sessions.
    InstructorDashboardScreen
    The InstructorDashboardScreen class creates a screen where an instructor can view high score data and other game-related statistics.
    Level1Game
    This class represents the levels of the game.
    Level2Game
    This class represents the theme levels of the game.
    levelData
    The `levelData` class in Java stores data for different levels of a quiz game, including options, correct answers, hints, image paths, and fun facts for each level.
    LevelSelectionScreen
    Represents the screen for level selection in the game.
    LoadGameScreen
    A screen for loading a game through user authentication.
    MainMenuScreen
    The `MainMenuScreen` class in Java represents the main menu screen of a game with various menu options and functionality.
    NewGameScreen
    Represents the screen for creating a new game profile, allowing the user to enter a username and password.
    ThemeBasedModeSelectionScreen
    The ThemeBasedModeSelectionScreen class allows the player to select a theme for their gameplay.
    ThemeLevelData
    The `ThemeLevelData` class in Java represents quiz data for different themes like Landmarks, Traditional Clothing, and Flags, with methods to initialize the data based on the theme level provided and a constructor to set up the quiz data for each theme.
    TutorialScreen
    The `TutorialScreen` class extends `GameScreen` and provides a tutorial interface with various buttons and tooltips for a game.
